image.altText: First responders arrive at the scene of a Greyhound bus collision on Bruce Highway.

props.synopsis: Work is underway to determine the cause of a fatal bus crash in north Queensland, which left at least three people dead and several more injured.

title.children: Investigators piecing together cause of 'very confronting' fatal collision between bus and car

image.altText: A skyline view of Gaza showing two white phosphorus bombs exploding in the distance.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into superannuation funds offering members "ethical" or "socially aware" options unearths millions of dollars of retirement savings invested in companies that make some of the most controversial and devastating weapons of war.

title.children: 'Shocking' weapons investments uncovered in Australia's most ethical super

image.altText: a composite image shows a man with glasses pointing and a woman in a muslim headscarf smiling

props.synopsis: Fatima Payman's calculated defiance is also in many ways the worst outcome for Labor. This painful episode has shown the power of this one senator to unleash a seismic political disruptor inside the party. But the events of the past days have also revealed Payman's unexpected political ally within Labor.

title.children: Crisis talks at The Lodge sealed Fatima Payman's penalty but she has won an unlikely ally

image.altText: Clouds of dark smoke in front of an orange fire.

props.synopsis: An underground inferno is pumping out clouds of black smoke in Central Queensland as emergency services try to extinguish it, with experts warning it could take weeks.

title.children: Residents warned to stay indoors amid battle to stop underground mine inferno, as black smoke fills sky

image.altText: a house with solar panels on the roof

props.synopsis: Australians being wrenched into the teeth of the energy transition can expect more change from today amid new prices, solar charges and government largesse.

title.children: Solar charges and taxpayer-funded 'sugar hits': What the new financial year means for your power bill

image.altText: A logo says 'ASIC'.

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission is timid and slow and was once described as "a haven for white-collar crime". A parliamentary inquiry due this week is expected to be brutal in its assessment of the regulator. Will its recommendations chart a path forward?

title.children: An inquiry into ASIC drops this week and insiders say the findings are brutal

image.altText: A woman sits looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: A brother lost in the bush, a sister who never came home, a missing backpacker and a mum likely murdered. These are the families left behind after a loved one vanished without a trace.

title.children: 56,000 people were reported missing in Australia last year. The families of those who haven't come home never stop searching

image.altText: Tim Franklin raises his arms as he approaches the finish line

props.synopsis: It was an epic effort that involved thousands of kilometres and 21 pairs of shoes. On Sunday Tim Franklin ended his round-the-world run where he began, in Brisbane.

title.children: Runner Tim Franklin ends 576-day run around the world in Brisbane

image.altText: A yellow sale sign advertising a newly built house is on the market.

props.synopsis: An expert panel of top economic forecasters expects the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates two to three times over the next 18 months, with the first cut likely in March.

title.children: Cheaper mortgages and even higher home prices: 29 forecasters share their predictions for Australia's economy

image.altText: A man holding a bike helmet under his arm

props.synopsis: By allowing cyclists to ride in the centre of the road, Toowoomba's Pierce Street is changing conversations around transport and urban planning.

title.children: Welcome to the street where cyclists are in the driver's seat

image.altText: Eman Soliman in her home looks at the camera as she talks about no-fault evictions

props.synopsis: Fifteen months after both major parties in NSW promised to end no-fault evictions, the government is yet to put forward new legislation, as more renters are pushed out of their homes amid a rental crisis.

title.children: Eman was told she was a good tenant, but without warning received an eviction notice

image.altText: Rusted barrels covered in snow at the abandoned Wilkes station in Antarctica.

props.synopsis: Wilkes Station in Antarctica has been abandoned since 1969. The site, with its old fuel drums, asbestos buildings and other waste, has been described by a French inspection team as "concerning" to the local environment.

title.children: Australia's abandoned Antarctic base untouched since 1969 poses 'clear risk' to environment, French team says

image.altText: A young woman with long light brown hair and a brown singlet. Behind is a brick building and fence.

props.synopsis: Without anywhere safe and secure to call home, Hailey felt like she didn't have a future. Her grades crashed and her mental health suffered. She's not alone.

title.children: For Hailey, being homeless and in high school felt like 'hell on Earth'

image.altText: Marine Le Pen, blonde woman, stands at podium with arms out

props.synopsis: Exit polls show Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally party has secured 34 per cent of votes in the first round of polling in France's snap election.

title.children: French election exit polls show strong result for Marine Le Pen and far-right

image.altText: The red earth corrugations of an old mine pit surround a beautiful blue lake at the bottom.

props.synopsis: Now a ghost town, the community of Mary Kathleen disappeared after the nearby uranium mine closed in 1982. But in its heyday, it was an oasis in outback Queensland.

title.children: The final days of a ghost uranium mining town, shuttered and sold for parts

image.altText: A silhouette of a person vaping with an orange light behind the vapour cloud.

props.synopsis: Jill's vaping dependence and attempts to quit became a social media journey followed by millions. Here's what she thinks about the changes to Australia's vaping laws.

title.children: Vapers are skeptical of the new vape laws coming into effect today

image.altText: A baby being give a vaccine.

props.synopsis: Australia is heading towards a whooping cough epidemic, with cases surging past 11,000 over the past six months, compared to 2,447 in all of last year.

title.children: Australia is facing the worst whooping cough season in eight years. Here's what to look out for

image.altText: A man wearing a white button down top standing in front of a desk.

props.synopsis: Victoria's first-of-its-kind treaty body has launched an official negotiations database, marking the state's first step on its nation-leading historic journey towards treaty.

title.children: For generations Indigenous people have fought for a treaty. Now it's a step closer

image.altText: Dirt road with some houses either side.

props.synopsis: A victim of domestic violence shares her story of survival, as lawyers and academics warn governments that rural communities are "drowning in" family abuse cases.

title.children: 'No-one will hear you scream': The dark side of rural Australia

image.altText: 1950s house in black and white

props.synopsis: Why did we make it harder for younger Australians and low-income workers to own homes? Did we forget some wisdom from the past?

title.children: Do you love renting? Does it make you feel patriotic?

image.altText: A woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The family of Sarah Miles, who was allegedly murdered in her home at Casino, northern NSW, have thanked first responders who tried to help the much-loved mother.

title.children: Sarah Miles remembered as 'loving, talented' mother, as partner is charged with murder

image.altText: Black writing saying "blood on your hands" on a concrete memorial.

props.synopsis: Memorial sites along Canberra's Anzac Parade near the Australian War Memorial are graffitied with comments relating to the ongoing conflict in Gaza.

title.children: War memorials on Canberra's Anzac Parade vandalised with comments relating to ongoing Gaza conflict

image.altText: Senator Fatima Payman with hand on her mouth at Environment estimates committee

props.synopsis: Labor senator Fatima Payman has been "indefinitely suspended" from the Labor Party caucus by the prime minister after a series of defiant actions regarding her support for Palestine.

title.children: Senator Fatima Payman 'indefinitely suspended' from Labor Party caucus

image.altText: Chris Martin from Coldplay on stage singing with a microphone in hand and the band behind him

props.synopsis: From Coldplay's record-breaking headline set to Michael J Fox strumming away on an electric guitar, there was something for everyone.

title.children: Michael J Fox joins Coldplay on guitar during Glastonbury headlining set

image.altText: An Australian male rugby player in a Wallabies jersey walks with his mouthguard hanging out of his mouth.

props.synopsis: After a record-breaking career, former Wallabies skipper Michael Hooper retires from Australian rugby with immediate effect after missing out on the rugby sevens Olympic squad.

title.children: Former Wallabies skipper Michael Hooper announces immediate retirement from Australian rugby

image.altText: Jay Slater smiles as he poses for a photo

props.synopsis: The search for 19-year-old Jay Slater, the 11th person to go missing on a Spanish island this year, is called off by authorities in Tenerife nearly two weeks after he was last seen.

title.children: Search for missing British teen Jay Slater on Spanish island called off

image.altText: A pride flag before Capitol HIll

props.synopsis: One LGBTQIA+ Missourian says living in the US state — where 39 anti-LGBTQIA+ bills are currently in progress — means having "your humanity litigated day-after-day".

title.children: There's an uneasy quiet looming over Pride in the US. More than 500 anti-LGBTQIA+ bills could be to blame

image.altText: A smiling Carlton captain Patrick Cripps holds his arms out in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: The Hawks sweep aside the Eagles to stay in the race for finals, after Carlton cruises to victory at the MCG and the Power give Ken Hinkley a vital win.

title.children: Captain Cripps helps Carlton cruise to victory, as Hawks, Power get vital wins

image.altText: Joseph Manu is helped off the field

props.synopsis: The Roosters' perfect performance against Wests Tigers was ruined only by a suspected broken hand suffered by Joey Manu. North Queensland stun Penrith and the Dragons beat the Dolphins.

title.children: Roosters star suffers suspected broken hand as tricolours dominate Wests Tigers

image.altText: Clouds of dark smoke in front of an orange fire.

props.synopsis: An underground inferno is pumping out clouds of black smoke in Central Queensland as emergency services try to extinguish it, with experts warning it could take weeks.

title.children: Residents warned to stay indoors amid battle to stop underground mine inferno, as black smoke fills sky

image.altText: a large police sign on a metal structure

props.synopsis: A sprawling fight in the Kimberley community of Halls Creek has raised concerns about violence becoming normalised, prompting calls for greater leadership.

title.children: Police fly into remote town to quell 'totally unacceptable' brawl as offenders brandish knives and metal bars

image.altText: A young white man in a white tshirt and blue apron, stands in a busy commercial kitchen looking stressed

props.synopsis: The Bear and The Boys are among the shows returning for highly anticipated seasons this month.

title.children: A bunch of TV series returned in June. Here’s what you should be watching

image.altText: Shane Rose rode Virgil to silver in Tokyo.

props.synopsis: Mankini-gate is what Shane Rose thought might bring his Olympic dream undone but he's had to fight through more than that after a 625-kilogram horse named Bandit came crashing down upon him.

title.children: Shane Rose is more than a mankini-clad larrikin. He's a triple-Olympic medallist chasing a near-impossible gold
